body:
In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Apr 6, 2017, 05:49

Flake8 doesn't look to environment variables for anything. Is using `--config` out of the question for you?

In GitLab by @OmeGak on Apr 6, 2017, 07:58

I could add an alias `alias flake8='flake8 --config=<mypath>'`. The thing is, I would like my text editor to pick up the config, but the alias won't be available to it. Any idea how I could achieve that? Also, out of curiosity, is there any reason why `flake8` shouldn't look at env vars?

In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Oct 20, 2018, 16:47

> is there any reason why `flake8` shouldn't look at env vars?

Flake8 already looks in several places for configuration files. Checking the environment variable introduces yet one more path that a user would have to investigate to find the source of some odd configuration they're not expecting. We've tried to improve visibility into where things come from via logging, but most often I'm emailed for help finding where config values are coming from because the status today is so confusing and murky.

In GitLab by @chaoflow on Aug 10, 2019, 07:47

@sigmavirus24 In what way are [user configuration files](http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/configuration.html#user-configuration) used at the moment?

``-v`` does not list the config file, ``-vv`` logs it but produces roughly 20k lines of log message. I think this should be more clearly visible.

Do you see reasons against printing the used config file(s) before any error messages, even without ``-v``?

In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Aug 10, 2019, 07:54

@chaoflow I don't think this is the appropriate place for a discussion about user config files or how they're used in detail. Perhaps this recent pull request helps you: https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8/merge_requests/336/diffs

> Do you see reasons against printing the used config file(s) before any error messages, even without `-v`?

Yes that will completely break every tool that parses the output of Flake8 in an automated fashion.

In GitLab by @chaoflow on Aug 10, 2019, 08:28

@sigmavirus24 Yes, thank you, that MR explains it!
